name: Dr. Chika Yinka-Banjo
bio: Dr. Yinka-Banjo leads AIRLab with expertise in Artificial Intelligence and Human-Computer Interaction. Her research focuses on ethical AI development and accessible technology solutions.

name: Mrs Omokhaba Blessing Yama
bio: Mrs. Yama specializes in robotics and autonomous systems. She has extensive experience in developing intelligent control systems for real-world applications.

name: Ayodeji Atunrase
bio: Ayodeji's research focuses on deep learning applications in medical imaging, working to make healthcare diagnostics more accessible and accurate.

name: Oluwatobi Anuoluwapo
bio: Oluwatobi is working on natural language processing for Nigerian languages, developing models to bridge the digital language divide.

name: Adekunle Abdulazeez
bio: Adekunle specializes in machine learning applications for smart grid optimization and energy management systems.

name: Lawal Giyath
bio: Lawal is researching reinforcement learning algorithms for robotic navigation in complex, unstructured environments.

name: Lukman Abdulsalam
bio: Lukman focuses on computational linguistics and developing NLP tools for African languages.

name: Ifedayo Olowonyo
bio: Ifedayo researches ethical AI, focusing on bias detection and mitigation in machine learning systems.

name: Aaliyah Omar Jabita
bio: Aaliyah studies human-robot interaction, particularly in educational contexts and social robotics.

name: David Okonkwo
bio: David works on computer vision applications for autonomous systems and object recognition.

name: Oluokun Fiyinfoluwa
bio: Fiyinfoluwa researches machine learning for predictive analytics in healthcare systems.

name: Tomilola Jaiyeoba
bio: Tomilola focuses on IoT systems and smart city applications using AI-driven analytics.

name: Jude Tochy
bio: Jude works on robotics for educational purposes, developing interactive learning tools for STEM education.
